para.p: and then

For

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((1 / nfactorial) * H _ n * 0 * z ^ n) = exponential@(- z ^ 2) = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((- z ^ 2) ^ n / nfactorial)

para.p: thus

Math.text: formulae@(H _ (2 * n) * 0 = (- 1) ^ n * ((2 * n)factorial / nfactorial), H _ (2 * n + 1) * 0 = 0)

Math.text: formulae@(u ^ prime * x = (- x * u) + e ^ (- x ^ 2 / 2) * (H _ n) ^ prime * x, u ^ prime2 * x = (- u - x * u ^ prime - x * e ^ (- x ^ 2 / 2) * (H _ n) ^ prime * x) + e ^ (- x ^ 2 / 2) * (H _ n) ^ prime2 * x)

para.p: Using

Math.text: formulae@((H _ n) ^ prime * x = 2 * x * H _ n * x - H _ (n + 1) * x, (H _ n) ^ prime * x = 2 * n * H _ (n - 1) * x)

para.p: we get

Math.text: ((H _ n) ^ prime2 * x - 2 * x * (H _ n) ^ prime * x) + 2 * n * H _ n * x = 0

para.p: and thence

Math.text: u ^ prime2 = ((- u) + x ^ 2 * u) - 2 * n * u

(- lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * v _ 1 * x * ((integral _ 0) ^ x)@(v _ 2 * t * g * t * differential-d@(t))) + lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * v _ 2 * x * ((integral _ 0) ^ x)@(v _ 1 * t * g * t * differential-d@(t))

absent = a * cosine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * x) + b * lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * sine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * x)
+ lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * ((integral _ 0) ^ x)@((cosine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * t) * sine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * x) - sine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * t) * cosine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * x)) * g * t * differential-d@(t))
+ lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * ((integral _ 0) ^ x)@((cosine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * t) * sine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * x) - sine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * t) * cosine@(lambda ^ (1 / 2) * x)) * g * t * differential-d@(t))

absent less= ((absolute-value@(x)) ^ 5 / 10) cdot (integral _ R)@(e ^ (- t ^ 2) * (absolute-value@(H _ (2 * k) * t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t))

absent = (((absolute-value@(x)) ^ 5 / 10) cdot 2 ^ (2 * k)) * (2 * k)factorial * square-root@(pi)

Math.text: absolute-value@(r _ (2 * k) * x) less= pi ^ (1 / 4) * ((absolute-value@(x)) ^ (5 / 2) / square-root@(10)) * 2 ^ k * square-root@((2 * k)factorial)

para.p: By Stirling’s approximation,

Math.text: (2 ^ k * square-root@((2 * k)factorial)) / (2 * k)factorial / kfactorial = (2 ^ k * kfactorial) / square-root@((2 * k)factorial) similar-to (2 ^ k * (2 * pi * k) ^ (1 / 2) * k ^ k * e ^ (- k)) / ((4 * pi * k) ^ (1 / 2) * (2 * k) ^ (2 * k) * e ^ (- 2 * k)) ^ (1 / 2) = pi ^ (1 / 4) * k ^ (1 / 4)
(2 ^ k * square-root@((2 * k)factorial)) / (2 * k)factorial / kfactorial

absent = (2 ^ k * kfactorial) / square-root@((2 * k)factorial) similar-to (2 ^ k * (2 * pi * k) ^ (1 / 2) * k ^ k * e ^ (- k)) / ((4 * pi * k) ^ (1 / 2) * (2 * k) ^ (2 * k) * e ^ (- 2 * k)) ^ (1 / 2) = pi ^ (1 / 4) * k ^ (1 / 4)

para.p: Thangavelu states the following inequality and asymptotics without proof, and refers to Szegő and Muckenhoupt. 11 footnote 11 11 footnote 11 Sundaram Thangavelu, Lectures on Hermite and Laguerre Expansions, pp. 26–27, Lemma 1.5.1 and Lemma 1.5.2; Gábor Szegő, Orthogonal Polynomials; Benjamin Muckenhoupt, Mean convergence of Hermite and Laguerre series. II, Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 147 (1970), 433–470, Lemma 15.

Math.text: ((norm@(H _ n)) _ p) ^ p = (integral _ R)@((absolute-value@(H _ n)) ^ p * differential-d@(gamma))

para.p:
Larsson-Cohn 12 footnote 12 12 footnote 12 Lars Larsson-Cohn,
L p
-norms of Hermite polynomials and an extremal problem on Wiener chaos, Ark. Mat. 40 (2002), 134–144. proves that for
0 < p < 2
there is an explicit
⁢ c
( p )
such that

Math.text: (norm@(H _ n)) _ p = ((c * p) / n ^ (1 / 4)) * square-root@(nfactorial) * (1 + O * n ^ (- 1))

para.p:
and for
2 < p < ∞
there is an explicit
⁢ c
( p )
such that

Math.text: (norm@(H _ n)) _ p = ((c * p) / n ^ (1 / 4)) * square-root@(nfactorial) * (p - 1) ^ (n / 2) * (1 + O * n ^ (- 1))

para.p: This uses the asymptotic expansion of Plancherel and Rotach. 13 footnote 13 13 footnote 13 M. Plancherel and W. Rotach, Sur les valeurs asymptotiques des polynomes d’Hermite, Commentarii mathematici Helvetici 1 (1929), 227–254.
